docs.name: Building Systems QA/QC Guideline
docs.description: Guideline to provide Building Systems Coordinators & Managers with a general framework and approach to delivering and implementing an appropriate QA/QC program for their specific project.

docs.name: Commissioning Guideline
docs.description: Guideline to ensure proper procurement, installation, and verification of project Building Systems. (To be coordinated w/ project specific specifications and contractual requirements.)

docs.name: Value Engineering and Cost Saving Guideline
docs.description: Guideline to help determine if there are any value engineering and/or cost saving opportunities that can benefit the pursuit or project. These are often called design alternatives and value cost approaches during the pursuit stage.

docs.name: Guideline to Building Systems Scheduling Input
docs.description: A guideline to assist Building Systems Estimators, Coordinators, and Managers in preparing and providing meaningful input to overall project schedule development. Focuses on ICI projects.

docs.name: Conveying Equipment Guideline
docs.description: Guideline to Conveying Equipment and their Building Systems and Structural Interfaces. Be sure to coordinate with local AHJs and code requirements.

docs.name: BIM/VDC Appendix to the Schedule A
docs.description: Wording that can be used in, or appended to, a subcontractor's Schedule A to detail their requirements to participate in BIM/VDC. Wording must be tailored to Project Specific requirements. Examples can be found in the Knowledge Base.

docs.name: Commissioning Plan [E26]
docs.description: Sample Commissioning Plan for smaller projects without a Third Party Commissioning Authority.

docs.name: Subcontractor QC Plan
docs.description: Sample QC Plan for Subcontractors that do not already have their own company specific plan.

docs.name: Occupancy Permit Checklist [N09]
docs.description: Identify and track completion of requirements for occupancy. Needs to be coordinated with Project Specific requirements. Additional examples can be found in the knowledge base.

docs.name: Close-Out Submission Matrix
docs.description: Matrix to assist in planning project specific close-out submissions. Including, O&M manuals, training requirements, warranty requirements, as-builts, spare parts list, etc.

docs.name: Building Systems Deficiency Checklist [C20-E38]
docs.description: Template for Building System specific deficiency tracking. Use to be coordinated with overall project deficiency tracking methodology and Fieldwire integration.

docs.name: Building Systems Responsibility Matrix [E05]
docs.description: Matrix to assist in the coordination of scope between subcontractors. Can be used as an Appendix to the Schedule A if signed off before hand.  Other examples exist in the knowledge base.

docs.name: Electronic Hardware Responsibility Matrix [E05]
docs.description: Matrix to assist in the coordination of scope between doors, hardware, security, and electrical subcontractors. Can be used as an Appendix to the Schedule A if signed off before hand.

docs.name: Elevator Cx Completion Checklist
docs.description: Typical checklist to track Cx status for elevators, including Building Systems and Structural interfaces. Be sure to coordinate with local AHJs and code requirements.

docs.name: ICAT Responsibility Matrix
docs.description: Matrix to assist in the coordination of scope between ICAT subcontractors. Can be used as an Appendix to the Schedule A if signed off before hand.

docs.name: VDC Level of Detail Matrix
docs.description: Matrix to coordinate and determine the Level of Detail ("LOD") required for various building elements.

docs.name: Building Systems QA-QC Guideline Program Elements
docs.description: List of Building Systems QA-QC Program Elements. To be using in conjunction with the Building Systems QA-QC Guideline.

docs.name: Close-Out Owner-FM Training Matrix
docs.description: Sample Training Matrix for planning, documenting, and scheduling Owner-FM training as part of Close-Out

docs.name: Planned Submittal Log
docs.description: Submissions module within Gatethree should be used. However, in the event a separate list is required, this template can be used.

docs.name: Building Systems Scheduling Input Checklist
docs.description: A guideline to assist Building Systems Estimators, Coordinators, and Managers in preparing and providing meaningful input to overall project schedule development. Focuses on ICI projects.

docs.name: Above Ceiling Inspection Checklist - Air Distribution
docs.description: Checklist to track and sign-off installation before boarding or ceiling tile installation

docs.name: Above Ceiling Inspection Checklist - Electrical
docs.description: Checklist to track and sign-off installation before boarding or ceiling tile installation

docs.name: Above Ceiling Inspection Checklist - Mechanical
docs.description: Checklist to track and sign-off installation before boarding or ceiling tile installation

tags.gcp_filepath: /bestpractices-docs/forms + templates/00024.FT.PS-R00-2017.01.06-Duct Shaft Inspection Checklist - Air Distribution.xlsx

docs.name: Duct Shaft Inspection Checklist - Air Distribution
docs.description: Checklist to track and sign-off installation before boarding or shaft wall installation.

docs.name: Legacy Building Systems Training & Presentation Archive
docs.description: Link to access the Legacy Building Systems Training & Presentation Archive within the Legacy Knowledge Base.

docs.name: Legacy Building Systems Knowledge Base
docs.description: Link to access the Legacy Building Systems Knowledge Base which includes archived program elements and sample documents.

docs.name: ASHRAE - American Society of Heating, Refrigeration, and Air Conditioning Engineers
docs.description: ASHRAE, founded in 1894, is a global society advancing human well-being through sustainable technology for the built environment. The Society and its members focus on building systems, energy efficiency, indoor air quality, refrigeration and sustainability within the industry.Â

docs.name: BCxA - Building Commissioning Association
docs.description: The Building Commissioning Association (BCxA) is an international non-profit organization that serves as the recognized authority and resource on commissioning.
